original: Advancements in microscopy have led to the identification of algae within the structure of lichens, prompting a reevaluation of their biological relationships. Initially, the presence of algae was attributed to contamination, as samples were often collected in damp conditions. Consequently, these algae were not recognized as being in a symbiotic relationship with the fungal component of the thallus. However, the continued multiplication
